Vc foi deitado pela serra do letherface, e ele te botou no porÃ£o. Agr ele esta num canto esperando que outro sobrevivente venha te tirar do gancho, ele deita vcs dois com a serra e faz a msm coisa de novo e assim ele ganha a partida em menos de 5 minutos.

Fun game, blast to play with friends.

Dead by Daylight is fun at FIRST. Enjoying playing with a friend, getting scared, running away. Or on the flip side, playing the Killer. Instilling the fear and having fun with their unique abilities. 

But if you plan to play this game any more than a couple matches a day I would highly recommend you TURN AWAY.

Initially it wont seem like it, and in fact will seem almost the complete inverse. But dead by daylight is extremely survivor sided. So if you want to play Killer, forget it. Having gotten to rank 1 as a killer myself multiple times(and rank 2 survivor), once you go up against survivors with all of the meta perks, that know what they're doing. You will not be having fun anymore. This game babies survivors to no end and it ruins the fun for an essential piece of the game, Killers. 

I don't wan't to waste your time with long, redundant statements and explanations. But if you like enjoying playing a game for more than a couple matches a day, or even enjoying playing it at all at a certain point. I'd suggest you unfortunately look elsewhere. 
If they fix the glaring issues, which they absolutely won't. Then i will adjust my recommendation.

Edit: 6/7/2021 Much later coming back to this review. There has been no change and unfortunately no change in the foreseeable future. Unfortunately i love the concept and hate that Dead by Daylight is the only successful game within this Genre. It is an absolute waste of money unless youre fine just completely dropping the game once the initial novelty has worn off. 
As a side note as well the community does not help one bit. Toxic, and biased. So many arguments but because of the inherent 4:1 ratio survivors to Killers. When looking more closely its more like 5:1 or more. There are always more people whining and complaining about X killer is too strong (none are). X perk is broken. They need to punish you for camping. When the game already does that inherently. Etc. The survivor bias of the devs and the very apparent nature that they do not play their own game or at the very least do not understand it. Is extremely disheartening.

6/5/2022: after taking a long break. coming back it seems it has only gotten worse. Though there is the potential for positive change with a supposed upcoming rework of the 40 most used perks and apparently the core objectives as well. We'll see but im not holding my breath.

TLDR: Blind/Deaf Devs. Toxic Community. Imbalanced game. Not worth your money unless you are ok with uninstalling after novelty wears off quickly.

The sweatiness and community in this game is horrible. Frequent tunnling and general toxic players. Horrible match making as well. I got paired as a new player with a single perk with people that had every advantage. If you're a new player don't bother with this game.

Death Is Not an Escape.

Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed.

Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey.

The Survivors' goal in each encounter is to escape the Killing Ground without getting caught by the Killer - something that sounds easier than it is, especially when the environment changes every time you play.

More information about the game is available at http://www.deadbydaylight.com
Key Features
â€¢ Survive Togetherâ€¦ Or Not - Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be selfish. Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone. Will you be able to outwit the Killer and escape their Killing Ground?

â€¢ Where Am I? - Each level is procedurally generated, so youâ€™ll never know what to expect. Random spawn points mean you will never feel safe as the world and its danger change every time you play.

â€¢ A Feast for Killers - Dead by Daylight draws from all corners of the horror world. As a Killer you can play as anything from a powerful Slasher to terrifying paranormal entities. Familiarize yourself with your Killing Grounds and master each Killerâ€™s unique power to be able to hunt, catch and sacrifice your victims.



â€¢ Deeper and Deeper - Each Killer and Survivor has their own deep progression system and plenty of unlockables that can be customized to fit your own personal strategy. Experience, skills and understanding of the environment are key to being able to hunt or outwit the Killer.

â€¢ Real People, Real Fear - The procedural levels and real human reactions to pure horror makes each game session an unexpected scenario. You will never be able to tell how itâ€™s going to turn out. Ambience, music, and chilling environments combine into a terrifying experience. With enough time, you might even discover whatâ€™s hiding in the fog.

5/14 update: Let's play DBD, haven't in a while. Should be fun. Third game in, random d/c - 5min disconnect penalty. What fun. And judging by the DBD forums, this has been a problem for years. Never change, behaviour. Trash can.

3/21 update: this game is a dumpster fire. Avoid.

When Obama told everyone that they should learn to code, the developers of DBD whispered back: No.

For a game with an incredibly satisfying gameplay loop, awesome licensed characters and tons of ways to customize your playstyle - the whole experience is a buggy shit-fest with horrendous "dedicated" servers, a broken matchmaking system and gameplay imbalances that leave a sour taste in your mouth.

Additionally, the barrier to entry for new players is insane at this point. The sheer number of perks (especially ass-tier filler ones) that you have to grind through to get a decent build going is lunacy. The bloodpoint grind in this game should've been addressed years ago, but why do that? To top it off, new players get tossed into the meat grinder with rank 1-10 players all the time (cue blackguy???meme.jpg) Seriously, has the collective IQ of the game dev industry tanked that sharply?

In the hands of a competent developer, this game would be a multiplayer masterpiece. Instead, bh-EA-vior keeps pumping out mediocre chapters to keep the DLC cash flowing. And it's not like they couldn't make a fortune on things like paid emotes if they just put a little effort in. 

They need to take a page out of R6 Siege's history. For god sake, if Ubisoft can do that, then this troupe of morons should be able to, as well.

Patch 4.5 Update: the collective IQ of the entire dev team is lower than room temperature. A failure from top to bottom. And I really hate streamers who think they have clout, but this game will honestly die when more and more streamers abandon this pile of shit. For a development company with an executive chef on staff, this is just embarrassing.
